alert.note: Alert for Northwest Middlesex County; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 7:34PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Worcester, southeastern Hampshire, northwestern Middlesex and southeastern Franklin Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 733 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fitzwilliam to near Westhampton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Fitchburg, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, Orange, Gardner, South Hadley, Easthampton, Belchertown, Palmer, Athol, Winchendon, Ware, Townsend, Montague, Templeton, Rutland, Westminster, Granby and Ashburnham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
